text: hello and welcome to community chats i'm
ali hammer and today we're interviewing
andy walker the ceo of dyno andy welcome
to the show can you start by telling our
audience a little bit about ditmo and
what it is that you guys actually do
yeah thanks ellie yeah thanks over here
um so dyno provides a network security
platform to help customers manage and
reduce network exposure across their
hybrid environments customers can
migrate and transform their i.t services
knowing they have complete visibility
control and governance over their
digital assets
thanks so much for sharing andy so how
does your solution actually help your
customers and what business problems are
you guys trying to solve
yeah so network security is moving away
from static perimeter firewalls to
automated application specific controls
our solution enables customers to build
network governance models to assess and
remediate non-compliant configuration to
ensure critical assets are protected so
senior management can report on the
overall exposure of their digital assets
and drive their teams to apply the
correct controls per application
we also enable our customers to
understand their income their current
environments for example
we use machine learning to understand
application dependencies to create a
secure baseline which immediately
improves their security posture and then
from that baseline they have more
knowledge to make informed decisions for
their transformation
activities
well it's really great to hear that
you're helping customers also reduce
those burdens on their teams
so andy how does dinner integrate with
aws to help your customers with their
overall cloud transformation
yeah so over the last few years that
node has provided a host based agent to
allow customers to discover and protect
their on-premises i.t services and which
really created a micro segmented network
we're now very excited to announce we've
integrated with the aws public api to
unify network governance and security
controls across on-premises and amazon
so customers have the flexibility to say
lift and shift on-premises vms to ec2
or transform their iot services to
utilize aws native services like ecs or
lambda or rds but regardless of the
strategy dyno will assess the network
security controls across the host space
firewalls and aws security groups to
ensure they all align to a strategic
unified governance model
very cool and andy lastly to round off
this into you what's next for ditknow
and how will you continue to help your
customers on this transformation journey
uh well obviously we continue to work
with aws to expand the services that we
support to cater for our customers cloud
transformation requirements
also we'll be looking to further invest
in machine learning and data science to
automate network controls and then
really this automated assurance and
security will help our customers
transform faster and drive
prioritization using a risk-based
approach
andy thank you so much for joining me
today it's been a pleasure having you on
the show and if anyone has any questions
please pop them in the comment section
below and we'll get back to you thank
you so much thanks
you
